Core:PCProperties.Core:Property: "Using +return by itself will send you back to your virtual home if you have that property set. +return \ sends that character to their virtual home if they have that property set.\\r\\n\\r\\nThe +return command will look for the property \\"home:return\\" in your body, which should be set to the object reference of your chosen room. This can be set to any room in the world.\\r\\n\\r\\nIf no such property exists, +return will instead look for \\"virtualhome:home\\" or the property defined by the server as the \\"standard home\\". \\r\\n\\r\\nNote that setting the \\"virtualhome:*\\" properties to a regular room is a great risk, because if your body is accidentally/purposely slain, every room in the virtualhome namespace of your body will be slain as well, unless it has the \\"virtual:noslay\\" property set."
"+return\\r\\n Sends you to your home.\\r\\n\\r\\n+return roane\\r\\n Sends Roane to her home.\\r\\n"
